keyPhrases.koreanTip: 'get started'는 '겟 스타티드'로 발음. 간결하고 에너지 있게

example.B: Yes, let's get started. First on the agenda...

keyPhrases.phrase: Moving on to the next point
keyPhrases.pronunciation: /ˈmuːvɪŋ ɒn tə ðə nekst pɔɪnt/ 무빙 온 투 더 넥스트 포인트

example.A: Any more questions on this topic?
example.B: No? Okay, moving on to the next point—the budget review.

keyPhrases.pronunciation: /ˈeni ˈkwestʃənz soʊ fɑːr/ 애니 퀘스천즈 소 파

example.A: That covers the first quarter results. Any questions so far?
example.B: Yes, could you explain the drop in sales?

keyPhrases.pronunciation: /tə kənˈkluːd təˈdeɪz ˈmiːtɪŋ/ 투 컨클루드 투데이즈 미팅

example.B: To conclude today's meeting, we agreed on three action items.

keyPhrases.pronunciation: /lets ˈskedʒuːl ə ˈfɒloʊ ʌp/ 렛츠 스케줄 어 팔로우 업

example.A: We need more time to discuss this.
example.B: Agreed. Let's schedule a follow-up for next week.

keyPhrases.pronunciation: /θæŋk juː ɔːl fɔːr ˈkʌmɪŋ/ 땡큐 올 포 커밍
keyPhrases.context: 회의 시작이나 끝에 참석자에게 감사할 때

example.B: Thank you all for coming. See you next week.

keyPhrases.phrase: The purpose of this meeting is...
keyPhrases.pronunciation: /ðə ˈpɜːrpəs əv ðɪs ˈmiːtɪŋ ɪz/ 더 퍼퍼스 어브 디스 미팅 이즈

example.B: The purpose of this meeting is to finalize the project timeline.

keyPhrases.meaning: 그 점에 대해 더 설명해 주시겠어요?
keyPhrases.pronunciation: /kʊd juː ɪˈlæbəreɪt ɒn ðæt/ 쿠드 유 일래버레잇 온 댓

example.A: We need to restructure the team.
example.B: Could you elaborate on that? What changes are you suggesting?

relatedPhrases: Can you go into more detail?

keyPhrases.pronunciation: /aɪd laɪk tə prəˈpoʊz/ 아이드 라이크 투 프로포우즈

example.A: How should we handle this issue?
example.B: I'd like to propose a three-phase approach.

keyPhrases.pronunciation: /let miː ʃeər maɪ skriːn/ 렛 미 쉐어 마이 스크린

example.A: I have some slides to show.
example.B: Great, let me share my screen. Can everyone see this?

keyPhrases.pronunciation: /bɪˈfɔːr wiː muːv ɒn/ 비포 위 무브 온
keyPhrases.context: 다음 주제로 넘어가기 전 확인할 때

example.A: Any final thoughts on this topic?
example.B: Before we move on, I just want to confirm the deadline.

keyPhrases.phrase: Can we get back on track?
keyPhrases.pronunciation: /kæn wiː ɡet bæk ɒn træk/ 캔 위 겟 백 온 트랙
keyPhrases.context: 토론이 산으로 갈 때 주제로 돌아오게 할 때

example.A: Speaking of which, did you see the game last night?
example.B: Can we get back on track? We have limited time.

keyPhrases.phrase: Who would like to take the lead on this?
keyPhrases.pronunciation: /huː wʊd laɪk tə teɪk ðə liːd ɒn ðɪs/ 후 우드 라이크 투 테이크 더 리드 온 디스
keyPhrases.koreanTip: 'take the lead'는 '테이크 더 리드'로 발음. '주도하다'의 의미

example.A: We need someone to coordinate this project.
example.B: Who would like to take the lead on this?

keyPhrases.pronunciation: /lets ˈteɪbl ðɪs fɔːr naʊ/ 렛츠 테이블 디스 포 나우
keyPhrases.commonMistakes: 미국: table = 보류하다, 영국: table = 안건으로 올리다 (반대 의미)

example.A: This discussion is getting too long.
example.B: Let's table this for now and come back to it next week.

keyPhrases.pronunciation: /ɑːr ðer ˈeni ˈækʃən ˈaɪtəmz/ 아 데어 애니 액션 아이템즈
keyPhrases.context: 회의 마무리 시 할 일 확인할 때
keyPhrases.koreanTip: 'action items'는 '액션 아이템즈'로 발음. 비즈니스 필수 용어

example.B: Are there any action items we need to track?
